titles: A merry and pleasant discourse betwixt Simple-wit, the tennant, and Mr. Money-love, the landlord. To the tune of, I am in love, and cannot tell with whom.
publisher: printed for W. Thacery [sic], and W. Whitwood,
notes: Verse - "When I do call to mind my former life,".
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
